member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Animation.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.param: The path to this animation's texture.
A rectangle that has information on this animation's sprite: X- and Y-coordinates, and its width and height.
The number of frames the whole animation has.
Whether the next frame is right of or below the current sprite frame on the spritesheet. Can be either "V" for vertical or "H" for horizontal.
The number of milliseconds between each frame. The higher the number, the slower the animation.
The index of the frame for the animation to start on.
Indicates whether the animation loops or just plays once.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Animation.SetSourceBox(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Set the size of this animation's source rectangle.
member.param: How much to increase the box by. Use negative numbers to indicate a decrease in size. Because of some weird setter shenanigans, just set 0 for X and Y lul

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Drawer.AddToDrawList(_30XXRemakeRemake.Move,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an animation to the list of animations to draw.
member.param: The move to add to the list.
Whether the sprite is flipped. If not, then the sprite faces right.

member.name: F:_30XXRemakeRemake.Fighter.charging
member.summary: A class for each species of fighters.

member.param: The position on the screen where the fighter is.

member.name: T:_30XXRemakeRemake.Game1
member.summary: This is the main type for your game.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Game1.Initialize
member.summary: Allows the game to perform any initialization it needs to before starting to run. This is where it can query for any required services and load any non-graphic related content. Calling base.Initialize will enumerate through any components and initialize them as well.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Game1.LoadContent
member.summary: LoadContent will be called once per game and is the place to load all of your content.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Game1.UnloadContent
member.summary: UnloadContent will be called once per game and is the place to unload game-specific content.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Game1.Update(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary: Allows the game to run logic such as updating the world, checking for collisions, gathering input, and playing audio.
member.param: Provides a snapshot of timing values.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Game1.Draw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.summary: This is called when the game should draw itself.
member.param: Provides a snapshot of timing values.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Move.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle,System.Int32,System.String,_30XXRemakeRemake.Fighter,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: A class for a single attack. This is a superclass and really never actually gets called anywhere directly.
member.param: The "direction" of the attack. Can be either up, down, left, or right.
The path of this attack's sprite.
A rectangle that represents the actual position of this move: Its X- and Y- coords, and its width and height.
A rectangle that has the hitbox of this move: Its X- and Y- coords, and its width and height.
The number of frames this move's animation has.
The position of the next frame in the spritesheet. Can be either "V" for vertical or "H" for horizontal.
The user of this move.
The amount of damage this attack does.
The amount of knockback this attack does.
The angle, in radians, in which this attack sends the target.
Whether the usage of this attack prevents the user from moving.
The number of milliseconds between each frame. The higher the number, the slower the animation.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Physics.CalcVel(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime)
member.param: The object's current velocity.
The object's current acceleration.
The quickest the object can go.
The games' GameTime. It's probably called "gameTime" or "gt".

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Physics.AddToCollisions(_30XXRemakeRemake.Fighter,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Adds an entry of the Fighter and its hitbox to the dict of hitboxes, to be used to check for collision.
member.param: The variable that refers to the Fighter to be added.
The Fighter's hitbox.

member.name: M:_30XXRemakeRemake.Physics.CollisionsWithStage
member.summary: A method that checks whether each Fighter is colliding with the stage. If yes, set their vertical velocity to 0.
